items.title: Micropayments
items.description:
Micropayments ask consumers for a payment to the publishers. The benefits could be access to certain features, or to remove advertising.

Within mobile apps this (in the form of in-app purchases) is a strong revenue source. But on the web there is little adoption, attributed to the high barrier involved with performing an online payment.

items.title: Pay-walls
items.description: Pay-walls block consumers from viewing certain content for free, but demand paid access by setting up a subscription or a one time transaction.

items.title: Remarketing
items.description: Remarketing allows advertisers to retarget specific consumers at later stages on different platforms based on their behaviour.

items.title: Header bidding
items.description: Header bidding allows publishers to have ad networks compete for a view by exposing a bid price, which then determines what ad network to load first.

items.title: Native
items.description: Native advertising are commercial messages integrated into the editorial content.
